raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "McCune-McBright syndrome", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "The clinical features described—precocious puberty (early breast development), café-au-lait spots (faint, irregular brown macules), and decreased serum phosphate—are classic for McCune-Albright syndrome. Red striae and plethoric cheeks may suggest Cushing's, but the combination of skin findings and endocrine abnormalities fits McCune-Albright syndrome best. Paget’s disease and hypopituitarism do not fit the age or presentation.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
